channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dead Tree Tunnel Avenue SE10, 28th February
item.description:
This tree is dead. It is a replacement for an identical species of tree that also died previously at this location. It is clearly not suitable for this location, Can a more hardy tree be planted in its place?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tunnel Avenue, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poo alley, 28th February
item.description:
There is poo on the pavement opposite 26 Sussex Road near brick wall and also approach to Steel Walk. Need even more stencils here. and warning signs.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sussex Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road Sinks Substantially, 28th February
item.description:
Torrington Park roadway has developed a very substantial dip in the last 3/4 years between Ashurst Road and the road narrowing. In the previous 20 years it was stable. It requires checking and monitoring. This follows a water leak reported some 3/4 years before the dip was showing. I reported it but it was not repaired for a long time. The leak was just on the park side of the fence near the current dip. They may be disconnected but may be connected?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 137, Torrington Park, Friern Barnet, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poo street, 28th February
item.description:
Hi Hengist Rd is plagued by antisocial dog owners. Today photos taken outside 33 51 81 99 and between Hengist and 1 Penda Street and on curb on 43 Hengist and Englebert Rd. This whole Rd and nearby roads need stencils and a deep clean and poo collection points. Where are enforcement officers?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hengist Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins routinely lined up on pavement, 28th February
item.description:
